thread.title: Jessie J slams people on Twitter
thread.title_full: Jessie J slams people on Twitter - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Jessie J slams people on Twitter
text:
Singer Jessie J has taken to Twitter to blast people for lack of empathy towards others.
READ: â€‹Jessie J wants to have a baby
The 27-year-old singer, who recently broke up with boyfriend Luke James amid fears he was using her to raise his profile, blasted people for not caring for others, reported Female First.
"The love people will happily give someone when it may be too late, is often the love they really needed to survive when they were falling.
"Next time you think about making a Instagram joke or to judge someone. Really think. If this was about me, if I felt really low would it help? We can save each other. But we live in a world where people will slow down at a car crash and take a picture before they jump out to help. We are all human. We all need love," she wrote.
For latest Music updates follow us on Twitter >>> @TOIEntertain
For the latest in Music news, like us on Facebook >>> TOIEntertain
Jessie, 27, who also posted a motivational message to a follower saying "You got this girl. You are stronger than you think," insisted her rant was not about her own situation and hinted she was referring to Lamar Odom, who is in critical condition after collapsing at a brothel in Nevada.
"When you are sick you put goodness into your body to feel better, right? Better food, medicine etc right? So when your energy is low you need positivity and support.
Why as a generation don't we get that yet? Anyone who needs a little love and support. Be there. When it's the worst. Be the vitamin to their deficiency. Be a light for them.
For more interesting Music news and pictures follow us on Pinterest>>> timesofindia
For latest Music updates follow us on G+ >>> The Times of India Entertainment
"So to anyone going through a bad time right now. (Whatever it is) Anywhere. If you see this. I care. It will get better. Don't give up.
"Just fed up of seeing people make a joke out of someone's dark moments. When if it if was being done to them in theirs.
Listen to Jessie J on Gaana.com
They'd hate it. Fact."
When a follower replied to Jessie by saying, "Exactly what is on my mind as regards Lamar's case,", the singer wrote, "Yes" and added "Heartfelt honest prayers tonight.
WATCH: Jessie J - Flashlight (from Pitch Perfect 2)
